comment: This was such an easy class, she lays every thing out from the beginning. You have a learning assessment and hw quiz due each week and then a test for that chapter. I never read any of it and passed with an A

SHE IS AN ANGEL. TAKE. HER.
The class is a little work heavy, but it is all fairly easy. 2 pretty short assignments due every week, 3 tests (1 gets dropped), and a non-cumulative final. She prepares you greatly for the tests and assignments. You don't have to go to class if you don't want, because everything is online, but I do recommend going.
This class was very easy if you do the practice questions. Class consisted of her reading off the slides that were already provided to us online. She is tough to listen to.

You don't need to come to class because all of her material is on the slides she posts online. If you redo the homework problems then you will be good for the test. The homework questions are very similar or the same on the test. The tests (webcam) and homework online. Her study sessions before the test were helpful if you had questions.

She was fantastic! All of her work was online and the tests were through lockdown browser and webcam. She allowed a piece of paper for notes for the tests. She also was really accessible in class and her study sessions. definitely take her!
This professor was amazing. All of the homework and quizzes was already online. She made sure the lectures PowerPoints notes matches the quizzes and homework. This was easy A class.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: This class is very easy and Professor Sedrakyan is very nice. No mandatory attendance. Everything is open note and there was only 1 test (not including the final) and both the test and final consisted of exactly the same material from the quizzes. Very easy class. It is impossible to fail. Also beware she has a thick accent.

She really wants you to do well in her class. There is a weekly quiz and homework (less than 10 questions each) and they are very similar to the practice questions we do in class. The practice tests are just like the real tests and also the practice questions are on the test too. She gives extensions on most of the homework. Definitely take her!!!
Easiest class to pass, you do not even have to go to class to pass. All the information is online, the questions from the homework and quizzes are usually the same questions on the test.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Really sweet professor and super cute outfits every day. Class was relatively easy with only two exams (midterm and final) but two quizzes each week. Camera & lockdown browser for exams. As long as you study the learning assessments youre good. Definitely recommend since all content is straight forward
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things--Online Savvy

comment: Amazing teacher! Very sweet and caring. One of the best I've ever had. Taker her!

She is a really good professor who easily finds real world examples of the issues being discussed in class and can communicate them effectively. She has an accent but was easy for me to understand since she uses a microphone. She put the time in to master the material and her craft and it shows.

She is a very caring teacher. Her tests were based on the HWQs & learning assessments. Homework each week, but very easy to locate answers online. I barely attended classes & got As on my tests from studying the HWQs, learning assessments, & practice tests. Answers quickly back to emails & accessible for office hours as well.

Always wore pretty outfits everyday. Easy course, 4 tests being majority of your grade but she gives you so many resources to study with. One quiz and one learning assessment every week on d2l. Ended this class with an A.

Amazing professor. Yes, lectures are a bit dull at times but you should still go to them so you don't have to study outside of class time. Everything on d2l is SO organized. There is 2 quizzes every week but they don't take too long and she gives extensions a lot. Tests aren't too bad, very similair to quizzes and drops lowest test grade. 10/10.
Very nice teacher and assignments are pretty easy overall. She gives a weekly quiz and assignment but questions are similar to the practice ones.

This class was super easy. One 10-question homework and quiz every week. She drops the 4 lowest quizzes and your lowest test grade plus the final replaces the lowest test grade. The class was super easy if you go to class and listen to the lectures. The exam questions are directly from the Homework and quizzes so if you do that you will be fine.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: This class was super easy. I went in person one time and have a satisfying grade. She posts a lot of practice questions and the weekly assignments are usually the test.

She is a great teacher! Her accent may be a little difficult to understand, but lectures are optional. Provides practice tests, allows formula sheets, easy to reach outside of class, and cares for your education. Take her for macro!

She is super nice! She's understanding and sometimes offers extensions on homework. The only catch is that she has a really thick accent which can be hard to understand if you aren't paying attention. Luckily she posts powerpoints and answer keys to class questions. She's a solid choice for intro to macro, just take notes and ask questions!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: She is a very kind professor and knowledgeable in the subject. However, she does have a thick Armenian accent and can be hard to understand at times which isn't her fault but just something to consider. Luckily, lectures are typically already posted PowerPoints so there's no need to stress about making it to class. Homework and tests are easy.

Accent is very hard to understand, but she posts all the lecture powerpoints. Tests are based on chapters, final is the last 4 chapters. Hw quizzes and Learning Assesments are due every Sunday and are exactly what is going to be on the test. Textbook isn't mandatory but can be very helpful.

Accent is very hard to understand, but she posted all lecture power points on D2L. As long as you read over those and do your hw quizzes you will pass. You can use a formula sheet on tests, which is lockdown but is exactly like the practice hws. All tests are on 4 chapters at a time, even the final. Textbook isn't mandatory, but can be helpful.
Hard to understand, but an amazing teacher.

The GOAT. Easiest class ever and cares about her students a lot. She always answers questions to clarify things if there is confusion. If you are majoring in ECON I recommend attending classes, but it isn't mandatory.
The lectures are kind of hard to understand but you really do not need to go to them. You can make an A in the class simply by doing the weekly activities and doing a little bit of reading.

Loved this class. I didn't show up a lot towards the end of the semester because I struggled to hear in class and didn't see a point. As long as you read the text book and do the practice problems she posts you'll be good. There is no extra credit, but I don't see why you would need it there are two small weekly assignments and three tests.

Very sweet and caring professor willing to answer any questions. However, class usually was just her going over already posted PowerPoints, so class was pretty pointless to go to. Easy homework due every Sunday and 3 tests on lockdown but they are not hard and you can use a formula sheet on them. You won't regret taking this class.

Dr. Sedrakyan is very knowledgeable and explains concepts well. She truly cares about her students and always makes sure they understand everything before she moves on with her lectures. She assigns weekly homework assignments and quizzes that arre fair, and if you complete and understand those, you are well prepared for the exams.

Every week there is are two assignments. One is a quiz that has 2 attempts and the other is a learning assessment that has unlimited attempts. Tests are a cumulation of the quizzes, learning assessments, and practice questions. She genuinely cares about her student's success and knows the lecture material she teaches. Final is not cumulative.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Overall a solid choice. The main complaint I have is that she has a heavy Armenian accent, so it can be difficult to understand on an online class, but in person is fine. She seems very smart and knowledgeable about the content and can answer any questions. She gave 3 tests (one was dropped), and multiple homework quizzes and assignments (easy)

Really good teacher, always willing to answer student questions and go into discussion. She was very sweet and caring. Graded on 3-4 tests and weekly homework assignments and quizzes. Easy class if you study the HW and the lectures.

She is very caring and she wants to get to know you. Online she can come off a little bit harsh first but in person, she always has a few nice words to people before and after the classes. There are HW and LA assignments every week, time is unlimited, more attempts, 3 HW is dropped. 4 tests including the final (very similar to HW&LA), 1 is dropped.

The concepts of ECON2200 are quite straightforward and professor Sedrakyan does not make them more complicated than they are. The homework and the quizzes are reflections of the exams, so make sure to master their topics. She is also fairly responsive so do not hesitate to e-mail her with any inquiries.

While her lectures aren't the most entertaining or really beneficial for the matter, her homework assignments and quizzes are extremely useful. These should be your main source of studying in the course. If you can master the quizzes and homework by taking good notes off of the PowerPoint's, you can easily earn an A in the courses.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Three exams, 53% of grade; lowest non final exam dropped. HW quizzes and learning asessments total 20% and mandatory final 26.7%. Know how to do the homework quizzes and learning assessments and pay a little attention in class and you will get >95% on the tests very easily. Responds to email quickly and is very sweet. Super easy class overall
